intro: Maxillaria nitidula, commonly known as the white-lipped orchid, is a species of orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its compact, pseudobulbous structure and produces showy, fragrant flowers with white petals and a distinctive yellow lip. The plant typically blooms during the summer months, showcasing its ornamental value. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Maxillaria nitidula is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal and ease of care in suitable conditions.
